SENT.plain: Providing anesthesia in nonoperating room locations is becoming increasingly common
The field of electrophysiology and its patient population are growing, resulting in a greater need for anesthesiologists in the electrophysiology laboratory
The procedures are complex and of long duration with patients who have multiple comorbidities
The electrophysiology laboratory is a unique situation in that arrhythmias are sought and sometimes even provoked so that they may be eliminated
The focus of this review will be on anesthesia for electrophysiology studies and catheter ablation
